page.title: 09FOREIGN STUDENTS
page.content: Brighton has now become Britain's fourth largest language teaching centre.This growth has particularly been a result of its location and the fact that since 1945 English has become the 'Lingua Franca'. In 1984 Brighton attracted over 25,000 foreign visitors with an average age of 23 years.The largest group of these come from West Germany (15%), followed by France (13%), Scandinavia (12%) and the United States (10%).The students are taught English for business and commerce- many are trainee businessmen and women who are sent to England at their companies expense.When in Britain the students stay with host families.
